Articles.Content:
Try is yourself:

Link here: https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/76866912/

Controls: W,A,S,D and watch the fuel.

I saw KurtJMac play this. Looks fun for five minutes

Edited September 18, 2015 by MalfunctionM1Ke
Too bad that you need the flash player I uninstalled that quite a while ago

Makes me want to somehow setup an experiment like that on KSP.

And yes, I played it earlier.
AAHHRRRRRR! This is so touturing. 300 trials cmoes with only 7 successl The feeling of spending trillons of dllars. $$$

Not exactly a KSP thing, moved over to the Space Lounge.

Pretty cool, reminds me a bit of the old Lunar Lander game from the '80s.

it can be found below (warning, the server might be overloaded).

https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/76866912/
32 attempts before cigar.

I was about to link it!

Got it to land after 17 tries. Sheer luck that I was in the perfect position and timing to hover riiiight above the barge as it slowly float under the rocket. Now to do this on KSP again!
wow, took me 180 tries to get 1!
Almost made it at fifth attempt, but suddenly it decided to tilt and explode. It waited landed for like ten seconds.
second session, almost got on the 18th attempt, but turned off the engine too soon. The velocity vector (press H to activate) is handy
I just realized that the intro music is an 8-bit version of the KSP mission control music. Neat.

I just realized that the intro music is an 8-bit version of the KSP mission control music. Neat.

Haha, that's awesome. I didn't spend enough time in the intro to get to the recognizable part... but now I'm only listening to this sweet music
134 attempts. Immediately tapping W just after a successful touchdown is just frustrating.
Got it in 22 attempts. Woot!
I didn't land it, lets just say I costed Elon Musk 15.25 Trillion Dollars...
I gave up after about 80 attempts. At least it isn't 3D!
I think this one is a bit easier: https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/76979756/

We should also be mentioning which level we were attempting. There are three levels of difficulty. Hitting space switches.

Easy - ground landing

medium - still barge landing, rocket comes from overhead

hard- Platform moves to the left, rocket comes from the left moving right.

I got the hard one in 23 attempts, didn't even realize there were easier levels.

I happened to get the barge landing on the first try, when the link was shared on IRC. The grass landing is somewhat harder due to the need to get translation and rotation right the first try before it runs out of fuel. The moving barge requires keeping pilot induced oscillation in check; instead of killing velocity and sending the rocket careening out of control, attempt to maintain a slight lateral drift within landing tolerance.

I don't have any special skills per se, but in 0.90 I have had built a very tall and rather dangerous

that takes off and lands in tail-sitter orientation.

Got the barge in "only" fifteen tries, including the two silly ones:

I've since tried the other two levels. Believe it or not, landing it on the third level (the one with the multiple landing pads and the grass) was hardest for me! Perhaps it's because that level had the lowest amount of fuel to spare...

-Upsilon
About 10-15 tries. My average track record is about 1/10.
Dang it 64 tries till I beat hard mode! Sorry SpaceX, im not your pilot

You guys have realized that the intro music is KSP right? XD

Geez, this is so frustrating but so addicting.
